title: Does the game seem less strategic to you?
body:
I dunno, it just seems that Riot have focused more and more on snowballing and flashy plays that they forget that League is fundamentally a STRATEGY game at its core. The problem is, there is only one real viable strategy at the moment, which is to gangbang botlane because botlane tower happens to be weaker then other towers.

One mistake dictates the entire flow of the game. But I think what is more maddening is when I see an ADC getting crushed and they somehow REFUSE to build any defense. ADC's have access to great items that allow them to gain resistances while not losing that much damage themselves ({{item:3156}} is an example) and yet I see ADC's building the SAME WAY, pretty much every game.

League at the moment, feels more like a deathmatch then an actual game about strategy. 

I suggested in one game that I go {{champion:43}} support with a {{champion:157}} top and smack about the enemy top laner until he screamed at the jungler for help. It drew the jungler up to top lane and did not allow them to do the usual gangbang in bot lane so our botlane was able to fight on even grounds with the enemy botlane and win through pure laning power. Yes, we sacrificed a jungle (I am a crap jungler anyway) but the strategy worked really well and we won the game because Yasuo got stupidly fed and I kept shielding him. (However, at the beginning, my team called me a "TROLL" until we actually started winning)

Why are people so against adapting to the current meta. Experiment, try new things. A wise man once said,

_"The definition of madness is trying the same thing over and over again and expecting a different result"_

If you have died in your lane, look at the scoreboard and CHANGE YOUR STRATEGY. Don't just blindly walk back into lane with your offensive only items and expect to win again.

replies.body: Don't worry dude. They are buffing adcs soon, and I kinda suspect they may tune down the tower fb gold or get rid of it because that is just another thing that is making games snowball so quickly.

Its not the power of ADC's that I think its the problem. Its the mindset of the players and the lack of variation in builds. Most ADC's will never build defensive items if they start losing. Something that I've learnt to do as a support player. You look at the what the enemy team is building and build around that.

They mainly don't because they are meant to carry the late game, and progress their build as quickly to that goal as possible.

ADC rarely has variations outside standard buildings that doesn't involve very few items like "GA, Merc scim, hexdrinker, LW(if theres a decently strong tank)
ADCs can't build defensive items because they deal no damage then.

OP means {{item:3156}} {{item:3139}} {{item:3814}} {{item:3026}} 

all of these are items that an ADC can purchase and no one is gonna think otherwise.  Yes it is the ADCs job to deal DPS in a fight, but if the other team is destroying your ADC before they can even get a shot off, and they could survive because of the MR/actives/shields that they above items give, then they should probably rush those items instead of continuing building {{item:3031}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3085}} etc just because "meh powerspike"  your items and your DPS mean nothing if you are dead

Problem is that those items add a bit of AD/AS on a champion that typically stacks high amounts of AD, Crit, AS, and quite often Lethality, and that's not even counting Lifesteal, which is probably meh useless on the losing end, but usually better than damage mitigation. Of the items mentioned, one has zero of those stats, one has movement out of combat (assassin-esque, basically the opposite of a carry's needs), one blocks less than a quarter of damage of only one damage type on the squishiest of champions (barring MPen), and the last has major protection against the same main defensive stat the others all already overload on, Magic Resist. Meanwhile, champions like Yasuo, Vi, Camille, and Rengar are popping in and one-shotting ADCs with little to stop them. These were meant to mitigate the abuse, but they won't dig you out of a hole like simply catching an enemy out, which is easier on full damage, and may be squandered otherwise.

These are items that full-on tanks forego for better protection elsewhere, and tanks are insta-deleted in this meta, particularly on the losing end of things. Why are we thinking a little trickle of damage mitigation is going to bring the tides in your favor on the strongest damage-scaling, most focused champions in the game?

All in all, damage vs. mitigation, either could save you in the right circumstances. But to say that the best scaling, most range-abusing champions in the game are unwise to build damage on the losing team is just wrong. In fact, the defensive bolster usually only works when the team is literally useless in peel, and basically uses you as fodder to Yi/Yasuo/Darius/Illaoi the enemy team out of existence, in which case your items rarely meant jack to begin with.

I mean, it's only one part strategy.  There was a really great post recently about how League is one part strategy, one part tactics, and one part RPG stat check.  I think many people get far too wrapped up in the tactics that they forget about the other parts, especially when playing mechanically intensive roles such as ADC or certain carry champs (*cough cough riven, cough cough yasuo*).  It's hard for people to change their mindset of the game, but really the only way you can become a better player is by looking at ALL aspects of the game rather than just one.  It does seem like the vast majority of people don't even realize that much.

Can people stop pretending that ADC's absolutely need nothing but damage. Other classes can deal damage as well just as reliably and hell, you have have {{champion:104}} who is tanky and can deal out massive damage. So not EVERY ADC needs to be built exactly the same way, like a glass cannon or else they suck. Other classes can make up for the loss in damage of an ADC.

99% of the time if you build a defensive item on an ADC before your 4th item you are going to be less than worthless. ADC's kits are designed in such away that if you don't have damage items, you just don't function as a champion.

Graves gets over 100 free resistances during fights which is why the extra MR and heavy lifesteal builds are cancer.  No other adc has a defense steroid to make these items worthwhile because enemy midlaners burn through Maw and kill the adc  because Adcs still have 1700 health. More efficient to build damage and hope for good peel and positioning yourself correctly than  building defensively and getting 2 shot by their midlaner and enemy adc anyways.

That's player problem, not game problem. I don't know about you but League has always had a trickle-down mentality where the top tier of players experiment and try new things while those below plat/diamond just take the scraps and copy things without truly understanding why they work. (ADC Ziggs.)
APC*

Building defense especially in elo hell is asking to lose as an ADC. With the 2 hybrid offensive / defensive items and let's say a GA. You will stil get killed almost immediately because you lacking Health to make your resistances mean something for you.

Learn to play safe. Never rely on your team even if they are reliable. Always play as if someone is out to get you because they are.

Forever Bronze V

I disagree. I've been on so many teams while climbing with a struggling to farm ADC who continues to grind away at components for a third or fourth damage item, and the situation at that point is typically this:

There is a fed enemy champ with burst and your ADC every skirmish and teamfight is dying instantly before getting more than a couple autos off from the fed enemy's initial burst. The rest of your team does decently strong damage and come the end of fights they are actually pretty close and it's a constant 4 for 4 give or take situation. 

Your win condition at this point is for the ADC to just buy a tank item like Deadman's. I'm serious, it's GG at that point. They won't die to one burst when dove, making their assassin look like a noob for how far they've dove, get movespeed to help avoid the burst in the first place, and believe it or not getting 5+ autos off with moderate damage is way more damage than getting a little more each AA but not being able use it reliably. 

People in low elo lose a lot of games by not understanding the importance of defensive stats.
